DOC.HEAD: Silent Movie Star Aileen Pringle Dies at 94
DOC.TEXT: Silent movie star Aileen Pringle, who had leading roles in in more than 60 movies, has died. She was 94. She died Saturday in her Manhattan home. Her movies, in which she often played an exotic siren, included ``Three Weeks,'' ``Souls for Sale,'' ``Puttin' on the Ritz,'' ``Adam and Eve,'' and ``A Kiss in the Dark.'' Her leading men included John Gilbert in adventure movies and Lew Cody in domestic farces. A native of San Francisco, she was born Aileen Bisbee. She was married to Charles McK. Pringle, the son of a former governor of Jamaica and to novelist James M. Cain. Both marriages ended in divorce.
